FuncDef:
The role master command specifies a master role for a node.
The undo role command restores the default configuration.
By default, no role is specified for a node.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the role of a PW APS instance as master in an E-PW APS scenario.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Virtual cluster access nodes have two roles: master and AP. A master node functions as a server and performs centralized path calculations, service provisioning, and traffic control for APs. After you enable virtual cluster access, run the role master command to specify a master role for an AGG on an IP RAN.
Prerequisites
Virtual cluster access has been configured using the virtual-cluster-access command.
Precautions
Running the undo role master command deletes all local virtual cluster access configurations.
